Enter-PSSession stop working connecting Linux to Windows. Also, this error is impacting the Ubuntu Bash console badly to the point that I'm force to close the terminal session. (I will create another incident for it).

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Enter command:
```powershell
PS /home/maxt> Enter-PSSession -HostName earth2 -UserName max_t                                                         
The authenticity of host 'earth2 (10.0.0.15)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:R3auoG/SZpsj8oCMmlchP2JRrtf+tj9+Tr4NJgKp+hY.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
max_t@earth2's password: 
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
To connect to Windows 10 PowerShell Core session.

Actual behavior
---------------
Immediate error after typing password.
```none
Enter-PSSession : The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has 
ended with error message: Failed to add the host to the list of known hosts (/home/maxt/.ssh/known_hosts)..
At line:1 char:1
+ Enter-PSSession -HostName earth2 -UserName max_t
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (:) [Enter-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.Management.Automation.Remoting.PSRemotingDataStructureException,Microsoft.PowerSh 
   ell.Commands.EnterPSSessionCommand
```

Environment data
----------------
Ubuntu 16.04.3 
PowerShell Core Beta 5
OpenSSH

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS /home/maxt> $PSVersionTable                                                                                          

Name                           Value                                                                                   
----                           -----                                                                                   
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                                                              
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                    
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.5                                                                           
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-89-generic #112-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jul 31 19:38:41 UTC 2017                     
Platform                       Unix                                                                                    
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                 
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                     
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                 
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
This error is coming from SSH
```
Failed to add the host to the list of known hosts 
```
It looks like SSH is unable to write to the known_hosts file.  Check the write permissions on that file and ensure no other application has it opened.  You can also try just deleting the file and SSH will ask you again to verify the host machines to connect to.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hi @PaulHigin,

I've already try deleting the known_hosts file with no results.  The error stills happening in Ubuntu.  But, no issues using SSH.exe (ssh max_t@earth2). 

:)

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body:
@MaximoTrinidad  Hmm, then I am not able to repro this.  With beta 5 I am able to use PowerShell SSH remoting to connect from by Ubuntu16 machine to Windows 10 and vice versa.

It is strange that ssh.exe works correctly.  It makes me think that PowerShell is starting ssh.exe process without needed permissions.  Are you running PowerShell in any unusual way, like under a different account that doesn't have permissions to access the known_hosts file?
